posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Looks good at first glance Dzmitry, there is not such thing as an overkill ! With both Devastating Critical and loads of Sneak Attack dice he will make short work of just about everyone that is not immune to them. Let's try to optimize it a bit,

1) Keep Dexterity at 15 and start with 14 Constitution for +40 hp's and +1 Fortitude that is your weak point. You are going to be in full plate armour all the time anyway, no reason to have 16 Dexterity there.
2) Take Crippling Strike before Improved Evasion.
3) Replace Defensive Roll that is nearly useless with Slippery Mind to help your other weak save.
4) At levels 36 and 39 take Great Strength twice so you end up with 30 strength and thus +1 AB, you need it more than two additional sneak dice.
5) If possible change the split to Rogue 25/ SD 3/ Fighter 12, and with your two additional bonus feat at epics take both Armour Skin and Epic Prowess.
6) Replace Dodge and Mobility with two save boosters, your saves are weak.
7) I do not see Discipline at all, given the fact that you do not have Epic Dodge or any kind of incredible Armour Class since you are not a Dexterity-based Rogue, even if you plan on going the Rogue's hood route, you risk your weapons to be disarmed.

Looking forward to see an improved version of it, i like the concept and what you have done already.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
The answer will always be more Attack Bonus. This is what allows you to connect your hits at first place and while i always love more sneak dice the difference that makes +2 AB is tremendous (+1 from EP/ +1 from 2 more strength). More strength will allow you also to have better Dev. Crit. DC.

The skill points i would take them from open locks perhaps. There is always the knock scroll to use since you have umd. Also you can optimize your other skills as well and save some skill points from there. For example 35 umd is generally enough for everything except high magic worlds, and there are other skills you can cut to optimum levels.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
You are also missing Blind Fight, which is a must-have.
Here's a completely different approach with better AB, AC, damage, Dev Crit DC, and saves. He abandons stealth, though. If somebody else (party member or henchman or summon) draws the attention of enemies, you'll still get sneak attacks.
Here's a caveat: the +5 saves from CoT and +4 spell saves from Spellcraft both count towards the +20 limit on saves, so if you can max your saves with gear, CoT and Spellcraft become less attractive.

posts.content:
Well, he doesn't have any spare feats to take it so the only option is to drop the (improved) knockdown for Blind fight. This isn't a problem however in any normal PW since if you go (Rogue 25/ Fighter 14/ SD 1) you can take everything that is missing (Armour Skin, Epic Prowess, Blind Fight). Dzmitry said though that in the PW he plays he needs 3 SD levels to get HiPS so his only option that i see is to drop the improved knockdown and remain with the simple version of it.

Good alternative build Empyre, i would go with either Scimitar or Heavy Flail for my weapon of choice. Also take Armour Skin before Epic Prowess.
